sentence.Network_en: Older people should not skimp on food or heating.

sentence.Network_en: She had to skimp to send her son to college.
sentence.Network_cn: 她必须节俭来供她儿子上大学.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: of unknown origin; compare with scamp and scrimp

entry.tran: 草率地做;马马虎虎地做;节俭使用;节省
entry.def: If you skimp on something, you use less time, money, or material for it than you really need, so that the result is not good enough.

example.ex: Many families must skimp on their food and other necessities just to meet the monthly rent.
example.tran: 就为了交齐每月的租金，许多家庭不得不省吃俭用。

means.word_mean: 1. work hastily or carelessly; deal with inadequately and superficially
4. supply sparingly and with restricted quantities;
